content.question: The figure shows a box on a horizontal surface. Which of the following free-body diagrams could be correct if the box is moving along the surface to the left with decreasing speed?

choices.label: The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A short arrow points horizontally to the left, a long arrow points vertically upwards, another long arrow points horizontally to the right, and another long arrow points vertically downwards.

The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A long arrow points horizontally to the left, another long arrow points vertically upwards, a short arrow points horizontally to the right, and a long arrow points vertically downwards.

The figure presents a free body diagram with four long arrows of equal length extending from a common point. One arrow points horizontally to the left, another arrow points vertically upwards, another arrow points horizontally to the right, and another arrow points vertically downwards.

The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A long arrow points horizontally to the left, a short arrow points vertically upwards, a long arrow points horizontally to the right, and another long arrow points vertically downwards.

The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A long arrow points horizontally to the left, another long arrow points vertically upwards, another long arrow points horizontally to the right, and a short arrow points vertically downwards.

content.answer: The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A short arrow points horizontally to the left, a long arrow points vertically upwards, another long arrow points horizontally to the right, and another long arrow points vertically downwards.
